definitions.definition: a person or company involved in wholesale trade, especially one dealing with foreign countries or supplying merchandise to a particular trade.
a retail trader; a store owner.
examples: the credit cards are accepted by 10 million merchants worldwide

definitions.definition: (especially in historical contexts) a person involved in trade or commerce.
examples: prosperous merchants and clothiers had established a middle class

definitions.definition: a person with a partiality or aptitude for a particular activity or viewpoint.
examples: his driver was no speed merchant
